newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's Airtel signs 120 bln pta syndicated loan.
newsitem.headline: Spain's Airtel signs 120 bln pta syndicated loan.

text.p: Spanish mobile phone operator Airtel said on Wednesday it had signed an agreement to receive a syndicated loan worth 120 billion pesetas.
The loan is the biggest realised by a private company in Spain, Airtel said in a statement.
The European Investment Bank (EIB) will provide 50 percent of the loan. A syndicate of banks will provide the rest. A total of 32 banks, including 10 foreign, are involved in the loan.

The deal will be underwritten by Airtel's four financial shareholders. They include Banco Central Hispano, savings banks Bilbao Bizkaia Kutxa, Guipuzkoa Donosti Kutxa and Banco Santander de Negocios, which is part of the Santander group.
BCH is acting as agent, and the Official Credit Institute (ICO) is acting as co-underwriter. -- Madrid newsroom + 34 1 585 2161
